title: High Proportion of Arable Land
description: In 2022, 60.52% of Bangladesh's land area was arable, making it one of the highest in the world.

title: Extensive Use of Irrigation in Agriculture
description: As of 2021, 78.90% of Bangladesh's agricultural land was irrigated, ranking it among the top globally.

title: Dominance of Textiles in Manufacturing
description: In 2018, textiles and clothing accounted for 56.81% of the value added in Bangladesh's manufacturing sector, one of the highest globally.

title: High Gender Parity in Secondary Education
description: The gender parity index for secondary school enrollment in Bangladesh was 1.24 in 2021, indicating a higher enrollment rate for females compared to males.

title: High Bound Rates for Primary Products
description: In 2022, Bangladesh had a bound rate of 179.79% for primary products, one of the highest globally.

title: Low Trade in Services Contribution to GDP
description: In 2023, trade in services contributed only 3.60% to Bangladesh's GDP, one of the lowest globally.

title: Minimal Domestic Health Expenditure
description: In 2022, domestic general government health expenditure was just 0.15% of GDP, one of the lowest in the world.

title: Short Duration of Compulsory Education
description: As of 2023, the duration of compulsory education in Bangladesh was only 5 years, among the shortest globally.

title: Low Antiretroviral Therapy Coverage for Pregnant Women
description: In 2022, only 4% of pregnant women living with HIV received antiretroviral therapy, one of the lowest coverage rates globally.
